page.title: 20Nant-y-Ffrith Hall
page.content: Bwlchgwyn had one large hall called Nant-y-Ffrith Hall. It was built in the 1820's by a Mr.Fry a tea-merchant from Liverpool. He died shortly after the Hall was completed. It was then bought by another tea-merchant, a Mr. Peak from London. At this time the Hall was used as a rural residence. However in about 1833 Mr.R.V. Kyrke bought the Hall. He was a descendant of a Richard Kirk, who founded the Bwlchgwyn Mines. The Hall then changed from being a country retreat to being a place which was lived-in, and the place where a man who depended on his locality had his headquarters. Perhaps the attraction of the Hall lay in its price as it had been sold cheaply, or in the fact that it was in an area of great natural beauty. The Hall has two cottages, a gardener's cottage and a laundry cottage, still standing.
